hypothesis: 2-source samples have higher RMSE (0.138 vs 0.104). Giving them more optimization effort (fevals, sigma) could improve overall accuracy.

tuning_runs.notes: FAILED - Reducing 1-src fevals hurt accuracy (-0.012). Increasing 2-src fevals didn't help (+0.018). Worse on all metrics.

result: FAILED - Specialized allocation hurts performance. Baseline is already well-balanced.
key_findings: Reducing 1-source fevals from 20 to 16 significantly hurts 1-source accuracy (0.1157 vs 0.104)
Increasing 2-source fevals from 36 to 42 doesn't improve 2-source accuracy (0.1558 vs 0.138)
The 2-source problem is fundamentally harder (4D search space), not just under-optimized
Baseline 20/36 feval split is already near-optimal
Time overhead (+10.9 min) is not worth pursuing
